## Reading
- Jenny Bryan, "Excuse me, do you have a moment to talk about version control?," *PeerJ Preprints* (2017) <https://peerj.com/preprints/3159v2>.
- Jenny Bryan, [Happy Git and GitHub for the useR, Chapter 1: Why Git? Why GitHub?](https://happygitwithr.com/big-picture)
- Lowndes et al., "Our path to better science in less time using open data science tools," *Nature: Ecology & Evolution* 1 no. 6, (2017), <http://www.nature.com/articles/s41559-017-0160>.
- Allison Horst and Julie Lowndes, [GitHub for supporting, reusing, contributing, and failing safely](https://openscapes.org/blog/2022-05-27-github-illustrated-series/).

## Assignment
- Make sure that you have Git downloaded on your computer.
- Set up Git to work with RStudio.
- Set up and account at GitHub.
- Take some time to go back over working on the command line.

## Activities
- Workshop: Git
- Workshop: Git and RStudio
